Love this game! great to play with randoms and totally fun to play with friends. The only complaint that i have is that sometimes theres bugs, but the support is usually pretty fast with getting them fixed. would def recommend.

If you are in any country that does not have servers for this game do not buy it.
The game Devs are absolutely pathetic and only care about how they can get more money from you rather than balancing the game. This game has been around for years and it is still heavily weighted to the killers and you seem to get punished if you have high latency. Not like some of us have a choice what country we stay in so why should we get punished for it.
If you like a salty community with pathetic players and an unfair game then this is for you. Otherwise spend your cash on something else.

**Update** They messed up the torch mechanics now in recent update, ++ to games garbage level.

I used to support this game, but with the current changes in Online MP games in general, DBD just got hit hard by toxicity. 

Playing survivor might not be the worst, I rarely played it so I wouldn't know that much, but playing killer isn't possible without being witch hunted, spammed, ddos'd, etc (at least in higher ranks, in lower ranks it's not that bad at all, and ironically, the game is more fun in low elo) Some high elo games are fine and have good people, but the majority are just toxic now. I feel like this isn't even just a DBD issue but a MP gaming issue.

But still, I don't recommend getting into DBD without a VPN and an iron mental.

I have been playing this game for almost 4 years now (not JUST this game, but still a lot) and although the game itself has a lot of potential to be really fun and interessting, it ultimately is all ruined by all the toxicity in the community. It's really sad to be playing a game in low ranks after not having player in months only to be met with very personal accusations and swears, no matter how fair you play as killer or survivor. Sure, sometimes you will get some nice "gg wp"'s in the postgame chat, but mostly it's just people calling each other sereoussly bad things and swearing about what the other players should or shouldn't do. I have my own thoughts on what i think is fair and fun to play against as both killer and as survivor and i try to play both roles in a way that is fun for both sides (eg. i dont tunnel or facecamp as killer or flashlight spam or teabag as survivor and such), but i don't enforce my vision on others. Unfortunatly, there seem to be very few ppl that play this game who think the same way. That being said, im still gonna give DBD a thumbs up (even though the devs definitely have done a lot better imo especially listening to community suggestions), because the game itself is actually really good, especially when you can play private games with a bunch of your friends. If you are new to this game, i would recommend hiding chat if you want to have a good time.
fun and thrilling. Matchmaking could be better. Not completely toxic haha
